channel.title: Better Microsoft Paint
channel.description:
Paint.NET is free image editing and photo manipulation software designed to be used on computers that run Windows. It supports layers, unlimited undo, special effects, and a wide variety of useful and powerful tools.
It started development as an undergraduate college senior design project mentored by Microsoft, and is currently being maintained by some of the alumni that originally worked on it. Originally intended as a free replacement for the MS Paint software that comes with Windows, it has grown into a powerful yet simple tool for photo and image editing.
The programming language used to create Paint.NET is C#, with a small amount of C++ for installation and shell-integration related functionality.
[img]http://img251.imageshack.us/img251/731/pdn30camarobsn2.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img251.imageshack.us/img251/2850/pdn25bmwbfn6.jpg[/img]
This paint software has more features than the normal microsoft paint, and you can also add plugins.
Download - http://getpaint.net/download.html

item.title: Better Microsoft Paint
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“brownsymcard, post:2, topic:90349”]Nice find, however it is somewhat pointless considering there are things like GIMP out there. Also, I dislike the whole lack of shift=straight line on the pencil tool. But FAR better than normal paint, and its a really small file size.

EDIT: Its runs pretty slow.[/quote]

Surely it doesn’t run slower than Java…

I use GIMP personally myself, but I think that it gets messy opening more than a couple files.

Read full topic
